Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fibrinogen Concentrates in Dilutional Coagulopathy

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a randomised controlled trial in vitro

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either fibryga速 or Haemocomplettan速 at doses of 50 or 100 mg/kg.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was clotting time (CT) and maximum clot firmness (MCF) assessed by rotational thromboelastometry (ROTEM速).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 samples were randomised, with 100 samples in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: All samples were analysed using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Substitution with HES showed no difference between the preparations, except for a shorter thrombin time with fibryga速 (p = 0.0093).

Funding.evidence: This study was funded by [source of funding].
